questions.label: What do I actually do?
questions.content: I’m a frontend developer specializing in high-performance, visually expressive web applications using Vue 3, Nuxt, TypeScript, and modern tools like Three.js, WebGL, and SVG. I actively participate in hackathons and programming competitions.

questions.label: Can you help me learn?
questions.content: I don’t offer formal courses, but I’m happy to share useful resources, architectural advice, or help troubleshoot specific technical challenges—especially those involving Vue, Nuxt, or visual effects.

questions.label: How does collaboration work?
questions.content: I work as an independent developer. Collaboration can be one-off (e.g., implementing a complex interactive feature) or long-term—within a team or during a hackathon.

questions.label: How long does a task take?
questions.content: Simple components or effects take a few hours to a couple of days. Full projects (e.g., a landing page with custom animations) typically take one to four weeks.

questions.label: Do you offer discounts?
questions.content: I’m open to flexible terms for educational initiatives, student projects, and non-profit teams.

questions.label: What inspires you in development?
questions.content: The ability to build complex, beautiful, and fast interfaces from pure code. I’m especially drawn to challenges where frontend meets graphics, animation, or real-time rendering—like visualizations, shaders, and WebGL.

questions.label: What do you do outside of coding?
questions.content: I take part in hackathons, experiment with new APIs, and follow trends in web graphics. I’m also passionate about sports—I regularly hit the gym.
